references.reason: This report is included because it discusses GPT-4, a significant large language model, demonstrating the relevance of its capabilities within the field and justifying why ScholarCopilot aims to improve on it.

references.paper_title: Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering
references.reason: It is considered important because it is a foundational paper on Dense Passage Retrieval (DPR), a key technique used in retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems which ScholarCopilot aims to improve upon.

references.paper_title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks
references.reason: This work is crucial as it establishes the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) framework, which ScholarCopilot builds upon and aims to improve for academic writing tasks.
It is essential because it introduces Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a class of generative models that are a baseline comparison point for generative methods ScholarCopilot aims to improve.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical Text-Conditional Image Generation with CLIP Latents
references.reason: This is included because it details DALL-E 2, a notable text-to-image generation model, providing context for ScholarCopilot's goal of improving generation through better citation and integration of information.
